subject: Re: Migrating from NetBeans to cmd line
msgSnippet: Hi David, I was using the fully qualified name com.acme..... I finally decided to bite the bullet and use ant. This is now working, i.e. tests are being
messageBody:
Hi David,
I was using the fully qualified name com.acme.....

I finally decided to bite the bullet and use ant. This is now working,
i.e. tests are being executed and an XML results file is produced.
However, I can't produce an HTML report.
My build.xml file is:
<?xml version="1.0"?><project name="Ant-Test" default="Main"
basedir="C:\NetBeansProjects\automatedTesting"> <property name="src"
location="${basedir}/src" /> <property name="build"
location="${basedir}/build" /> <property name="dist"
location="${basedir}/dist" /> <property name="docs"
location="${basedir}/docs" /> <property name="reports"
location="${basedir}/reports"/>
<!-- Define the classpath which includes the junit.jar and the classes
after compiling--> <path id="junit.class.path"> <pathelement
location="lib/junit_4/junit-4.5.jar" /> <pathelement
location="${build}" /> </path>
<!-- Run the JUnit Tests --> <target name="junit"> <junit
printsummary="yes" fork="yes" haltonfailure="yes"> <classpath
refid="junit.class.path"/> <formatter type="xml" /> <test
name="com.acme.automatedtesting.summariseTestCases" /> <sysproperty
key="propsLoc" value="C:\\POC"/> <batchtest fork="yes"
todir="${reports}"> <fileset dir="${build}/test/classes">
<include name="summariseTestCases.class"/> </fileset> </batchtest>
</junit> <junitreport todir="${reports}"> <fileset
dir="${basedir}"> <include name="./TEST-*.xml"/> </fileset>
<report format="frames" todir="${reports}"/> </junitreport>
</target> <!--<target name="junit-report" depends="junit"
description="=> generate JUnit HTML report"> <junitreport
todir="${reports}"> <fileset dir="${reports}"> <include
name="${basedir}/TEST-*.xml"/> </fileset> <report format="frames"
todir="${reports}"/> </junitreport> </target>-->
<target name="Main" depends="junit"> <description>Main
target</description> </target>
</project>
The ant error I'm getting is :
BUILD FAILEDC:\POC\apache-ant-1.8.0RC1\bin\build.xml:20: Test
com.acme.summariseTestCases failed at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTask.actOnTestResult(J\
UnitTask.java:1849) at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTask.execute(JUnitTask\
.java:813) at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTask.executeOrQueue(JU\
nitTask.java:1794) at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTask.execute(JUnitTask\
.java:761) at
org.apache.tools.ant.UnknownElement.execute(UnknownElement.java:291)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.jav\
a:39) at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessor\
Impl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
at
org.apache.tools.ant.dispatch.DispatchUtils.execute(DispatchUtils.java:1\
06) at org.apache.tools.ant.Task.perform(Task.java:348) at
org.apache.tools.ant.Target.execute(Target.java:390) at
org.apache.tools.ant.Target.performTasks(Target.java:411) at
org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeSortedTargets(Project.java:1360)
at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTarget(Project.java:1329)
at
org.apache.tools.ant.helper.DefaultExecutor.executeTargets(DefaultExecut\
or.java:41) at
org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTargets(Project.java:1212) at
org.apache.tools.ant.Main.runBuild(Main.java:801) at
org.apache.tools.ant.Main.startAnt(Main.java:218) at
org.apache.tools.ant.launch.Launcher.run(Launcher.java:280) at
org.apache.tools.ant.launch.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:109)
Total time: 4 seconds
I am using junit 4.8 and my understanding is that the optional.jar for
ant is included in the junit.jar... I have the junit.jar in the
ant_home/lib folder.
Any further pointers on how to resolve this would be much appreciated.
Thanks in advance.







--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
> Just to be clear, does nameOfJunitTestFile mean something like
> com.acme.testing.MyTest (which should work), or
> com/acme/testing/MyTest.java (which won't)?
>
> David
>
> On Wed, Jan 20, 2010 at 12:48 PM, lovejunithate
> johnadegbile@... wrote:
> > I am new to java and junit - 3 weeks. I have created an XML
message validation utility using NetBeans6.7. However, I now want to
package this so that users can invoke from the command line without
having NetBeans installed.
> >
> > A summary of my junit program from NetBeans is shown below -
> >
> > package com.acme.automatedtesting;
> >
> > import ...
> > import org.junit.After;
> > import org.junit.AfterClass;
> > import org.junit.Before;
> > import org.junit.BeforeClass;
> > import org.junit.Test;
> > import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
> > import org.junit.runners.Parameterized;
> > import org.junit.runners.Parameterized.Parameters;
> >
> > @RunWith(value=Parameterized.class)
> > public class summariseTestCases {
> >
> > private File fileURI;
> > private static String propertyFilesLoc =
System.getProperty("propsLoc");
> >
> > public summariseTestCases(File fileURI) {
> > this.fileURI = fileURI;
> > System.out.println("Processing... " +
this.fileURI.getName());
> >
> > }
> >
> > @BeforeClass
> > public static void setUpClass() {
> > ...
> > }
> >
> > @AfterClass
> > public static void tearDownClass() throws Exception {
> > }
> >
> >
> > @Before
> > public void setUp() throws Exception {
> > }
> >
> >
> > @After
> > public void tearDown() {
> > }
> >
> >
> > @Parameters
> > public static Collection<Object[]> getFiles() throws
IOException/*(String fileURI)*/ {
> > ...
> > return data;
> >
> > }
> >
> > @Test
> > public void testXML() throws Exception {
> > validateXML v = new validateXML();
> > ...
> > }
> > }
> >
> > I have JUnit 4.8.1 on my classpath (both the junit_home and
junit_home/jar file). I also have the path to my junit test case file on
the classpath.
> >
> > However, when I try to run from the command prompt (windows), I get
errors. I have tried numerous combinations of the following 2 commands:
> >
> > 1)
> > java -cp c:\pathToJunitjar;pathToTestclass
org.junit.runner.JUnitCore nameOfJunitTestFile
> >
> > Error: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
> >
> > 2)
> > java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore nameOfJunitTestFile
> > Error: Could not find class nameOfJunitTestFile
> >
> >
> > Can anyone provide any guidance/help/pointers/useful links on how I
can resolve?
> >
> > Thanks in advance.
> >
> >
> >
